error.message: aria-controls references non-existent id "hidden-categories". Broken ARIA reference provides no accessibility benefit How to fix: - Add element with matching id - Correct the id reference - Remove the broken reference WCAG 4.1.1: Parsing Found: aria-controls="hidden-categories"

aria-controls references non-existent id "hidden-categories". Broken ARIA reference provides no accessibility benefit How to fix: - Add element with matching id - Correct the id reference - Remove the broken reference WCAG 4.1.1: Parsing Found: aria-controls="hidden-categories"

Content may be hidden without visual indication in "Visually hidden utility for screen reader only content .visually-hidden". Text content may be cut off and inaccessible to users. How to fix: - Add "text-overflow: ellipsis" to show truncation indicator (...) - Or remove "overflow: hidden" to allow text to wrap naturally - Or ensure content is accessible through other means (tooltips, expand buttons) WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

Potential content overflow detected in "h3". This may hide text content inaccessibly. How to fix: - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

Potential content overflow detected in "p". This may hide text content inaccessibly. How to fix: - Verify all content remains accessible when overflow is hidden - Consider using "overflow: auto" or "overflow: scroll" for scrollable content - Ensure responsive design allows content to reflow at 320px width WCAG 1.4.10: Reflow

Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.card-arrow)

Animation without prefers-reduced-motion support. Animations can cause vestibular disorders and motion sickness How to fix: - Add @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) query - Disable or reduce animation when preference is set WCAG 2.3.3: Animation from Interactions Found: File uses transitions without properly disabling them in prefers-reduced-motion: reduce

Font size 11px may be too small. Small text is difficult for users with low vision How to fix: - Use minimum 16px (1rem) for body text - Use relative units (rem, em) for scalability - Test at 200% zoom WCAG 1.4.4: Resize Text Found: ".chip-count"

Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.cards-grid, .card-content)

Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.card-header)

Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.tab-content, .table-row)

Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.selected)

How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.items-header, .items-list, .selected)

Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.selected)

Complex interactive containers without :focus-within. Keyboard users may not see clear visual indication when navigating nested focusable elements. How to fix: - Add :focus-within pseudo-class to container selectors - Or ensure child elements (a, button, input) have visible :focus styles - Apply visual styles (border, background, shadow) when children are focused - Example: .container:focus-within { outline: 2px solid blue; } - Test with keyboard navigation to ensure focus is always visible WCAG 2.4.7: Focus Visible Found: Complex containers (.card-header, .item-number, .select-button)
